title: Settings help (Getting high ping a lot)
body:
Hey, I was wondering if these settings are correct to run League as smoothly as possible. If I need to fix anything please do let me know because I've been getting high ping consistently. (200ms constant)

http://imgur.com/a/xVu5v

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Vtu4fVmN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-31T20:53:59.760+0000)
>
> [Troubleshoot your high ping.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)
> 
> http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/su16_keyart_1920x1080_0.jpg?itok=6nj8mHjj

I'm on Linux it won't let me haha.

Though we don't offer official support for Linux, many of the steps in that guide will translate to steps you can take on your computer. From first glance, the two steps that can help the most are bypassing your wireless connection and changing your DNS settings to a public DNS server. None of the steps in your PlayonLinux client should have an effect on your connection, as far as I know.

Let me know if you have any questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Vtu4fVmN,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-31T23:40:33.041+0000)

From first glance, the two steps that can help the most are bypassing your wireless connection and changing your DNS settings to a public DNS server. None of the steps in your PlayonLinux client should have an effect on your connection, as far as I know.
> 
> Let me know if you have any questions.

By the DNS settings do you mean just going into my WiFi settings on my computer and just changing the DNS address?

 I believe it's currently just 0.0.0.0 under DNS.

This recently just started happening and it only happens for a couple of games. As for everything else Linux is able to run the game smoothly for me at a solid 80fps after configuring everything and perfecting all of the settings.

Here's Google's page on configuring your network adapter to use their DNS Servers:

https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using

Let me know if that helped.
